intro: Hieracium parmulatum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, rough stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium parmulatum thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
